meanings.definition: A humorous or satirical imitation of a serious piece of literature or drama.
meanings.sent1: The school play was a burlesks of Shakespeare's famous tragedy.
meanings.sent2: The comedy show included a burlesks of a popular TV show.
meanings.sent3: The burlesks of the classic novel had the audience laughing out loud.
meanings.sent4: Her parody of the award-winning film was a true burlesks.
meanings.sent5: The burlesks of the historical speech was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A variety show featuring striptease acts, bawdy comedy, and sometimes singing and dancing.
meanings.sent1: The old theater hosted a burlesks with dancers and comedians.
meanings.sent2: The burlesks at the club was a mix of humor and seductive performances.
meanings.sent3: The burlesks at the carnival had the audience blushing and giggling.
meanings.sent4: Her performance in the burlesks was both entertaining and risque.
meanings.sent5: The burlesks at the party was a highlight of the night.
